clinical_study.brief_title: The Application of Cognitive Rehabilitation Therapy for Amphetamine-type Stimulants Addiction
clinical_study.official_title: The Application of Cognitive Rehabilitation Therapy for Amphetamine-type Stimulants Addiction

brief_summary.textblock: The computerized cognitive rehabilitation therapy will be used to treat amphetamine-type stimulant (ATS) addiction.

detailed_description.textblock: The deficits in executive functions related to prefrontal-striatal circuits play a vital role in ATS addiction and relapse, and proposed computerized cognitive rehabilitation therapy as the novel interventions. Focused on evaluating and training executive functions including working memory, inhibitory control, cognitive flexibility, and congitive bias concerning prefrontal-striatal circuits, neuropsychological tests, electroencephalography tests, magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS) and functional MRI will be used to evaluate the therapeutic effect of ATS addiction treatment as well as investigate the mechanisms. The study will be very helpful to develop novel interventions in clinical practice and decrease ATS-related harm for both the patients and their families.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Craving for ATS assessed by Visual Analog Scales (VAS) at 1 month , 3 month and 6 months
primary_outcome.description: evaluate all participants' craving for ATS by Visual Analog Scales (VAS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression status assessed by Patient Health Questionnaire-9(PHQ-9)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate all participants' depression status by Patient Health Questionnaire-9(PHQ-9)

secondary_outcome.measure: Anxiety status assessed by Generalized Anxiety Disorder Screener (GAD-7)
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate all participants' anxiety status by Generalized Anxiety Disorder Screener (GAD-7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cognitive function assessed by CogState Battery (CSB)
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate all participants' cognitive function by the computerized CogState Battery (CSB) Chinese version

secondary_outcome.measure: Changing of response inhibition ablility assessed by Balloon Analogue Risk Task (BART)
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate all participants' response inhibition function by Balloon Analogue Risk Task (BART)
Follow up with patients after discharge, evaluate number of participants who relapse

arm_group.description: The main content of cognitive function rehabilitation esecutive function,including working memory,sustained attention, response inhibition function and cognitive flexibility, 45 minutes a day over 6 weeks period.
The main content of cognitive bias modification groups were changing ATS related attention bias, 45 minutes a day over 6 weeks period.
Participants only accept the regular scheduled in the compulsory isolated detoxification center

intervention.intervention_name: cognitive function rehabilitation and bias modification
intervention.description: cognitive rehabilitation focus on the deficits executive funcitin and elevated cognitive bias
